body_html:
@peterjc123 eventually succeeded in building a nightly install and a whl. firstly had to create a new conda env to start with. then uses the standard approach, nothing else changed, and it worked. however, the cuda90.bat script still failed with the same errors as above. anyway, thanks for the comments. Cheers....

Python 3.6.6 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Jul 26 2018, 11:48:23) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>>import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'1.0.0a0+61a2d47'
>>> x = torch.rand(5, 3)
>>> print(x)
tensor([[0.4662, 0.2747, 0.8144],
[0.2651, 0.8691, 0.7630],
[0.7829, 0.4789, 0.3436],
[0.5751, 0.9688, 0.9989],
[0.3075, 0.7193, 0.9348]])
>>> torch.cuda.is_available()
True
>>>

body:
@peterjc123 eventually succeeded in building a nightly install and a whl. firstly had to create a new conda env to start with. then uses the standard [approach](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch#from-source), nothing else changed, and it worked. however, the cuda90.bat script still failed with the same errors as above. anyway, thanks for the comments.  Cheers....

`Python 3.6.6 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Jul 26 2018, 11:48:23) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.`
`>>>import torch`
`>>> torch.__version__`
`'1.0.0a0+61a2d47'`
`>>> x = torch.rand(5, 3)`
`>>> print(x)`
`tensor([[0.4662, 0.2747, 0.8144],`
`        [0.2651, 0.8691, 0.7630],`
`        [0.7829, 0.4789, 0.3436],`
`        [0.5751, 0.9688, 0.9989],`
`        [0.3075, 0.7193, 0.9348]])`
`>>> torch.cuda.is_available()`
`True`
`>>>`
